image.altText: Ned Hargraves on a mobility scooter with his hands over his face.

props.synopsis: Emotional scenes have taken place at a vigil held for a Warlpiri man who died in police custody after an altercation in an Alice Springs supermarket.

title.children: 'A tragic day': Outpouring of grief in Alice Springs after death in custody

image.altText: Bawinanga Rangers

props.synopsis: Up to eight people, believed to be from China, have been detained by border protection authorities after reaching a remote part of the Northern Territory coast by boat earlier this week.

title.children: Suspected boat arrivals from China discovered in Arnhem Land

image.altText: A large white empty hotel

props.synopsis: The financial crimes regulator finds two casinos in northern Australia are at high risk of being used for money laundering and orders an external audit of both.

title.children: Two casinos to be audited after watchdog flags money-laundering risk

image.altText: A machine over a pile of dirt.

props.synopsis: As the first gold bars are poured at the reopened Nobles Nob gold mine in the Northern Territory, locals hope it will bring a return to the region's golden era.

title.children: Tennant Creek hopes mine marks return to 'gold capital of Australia'

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: The Darwin facility's 11 massive fuel tanks have not been built to withstand a category three cyclone, and an environmental impact assessment was not undertaken.

title.children: NT government rejects call for federal action on bungled US fuel tanks

image.altText: A woman holds a framed photo of a baby girl

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory police officer was set to face a jury last year accused of "callously" failing to rescue or render assistance to his partner. Then, weeks out from the trial, the charges were abandoned.

title.children: A police officer was to face trial over Sophia's death, then the charge was dropped

image.altText: Doctors and nurses in a surgical theatre operate on an unseen patient.

props.synopsis: The flow-on effects of private health provider Healthscope's financial woes are not only affecting patients — it's feared they could add to the exodus of much-needed doctors from regional areas.

title.children: People may ditch private health insurance after provider failure, doctor says

image.altText: A blurred tree in the foreground, with a sign reading 'Coomalie Community Government Council' on the facade of a green tin shed.

props.synopsis: After the sacking of a local Northern Territory council, a previously confidential report reveals councillors turning against each other and conflicts of interest at the heart of a regional rift.

title.children: Confidential report paints picture of conflicts behind NT council sacking

image.altText: The milky way seen with an  aurora australis over southern Tasmania, with green glowing along the horizon of the night sky

props.synopsis: An alert about a geomagnetic storm might not sound like a good thing, but it's exactly the kind of notification photographers of the southern night sky want to receive.

title.children: Photographers capture aurora australis over southern Australia

image.altText: One Nation leader Senator Pauline Hanson smiles at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Surprise Senate results will see Pauline Hanson's One Nation double its representation in the next parliament, meaning it will have the same number of representatives as the Nationals in the upper house.

title.children: Pauline Hanson's One Nation delivers shock doubling of federal senators

image.altText: An elderly woman looks off into the distance as she speaks.

props.synopsis: One Nation's success affirms the 2016 Senate reforms in ensuring that Senate elections were decided by voters, not the opaque deals of preference traders.

title.children: One Nation's victories are a vindication of the Senate reforms

image.altText: Rani Paige Lowry walks out of court surrounded by two reporters with microphones.

props.synopsis: Rani Paige Lowry was drunk and speeding when she crashed into then-Greens parliamentarian Amy MacMahon's car in Brisbane in February last year.

title.children: Drunk driver who crashed into former Greens MP spared jail

image.altText: Taped fist of Bec Rodriguez.

props.synopsis: An application to hold a legal bare-knuckle fight in Perth has outraged some in the community, but the WA government says banning the sport would drive it underground.

title.children: WA weighs up allowing bare-knuckle boxing match

image.altText: A blonde woman with glasses is smiling in a black shirt and jeans and leaning casually on a chair with a w and black background

props.synopsis: Manifesting has never been more popular. But while it promises you anything you want via the power of your mind, critics say the practice is concerning.

title.children: Manifestation may seem OK, but critics say we are ignoring red flags

image.altText: A woman in a white lab coat looking at the results of a scientific test.

props.synopsis: The World Health Organization designated the new NB.1.8.1 strain as a "variant under monitoring" and it's now the dominant variant in China and Hong Kong.

title.children: New COVID-19 strain 'pretty much everywhere' in Australia

image.altText: A person inserts a needle into a dose of Pfizer vaccine.

props.synopsis: The US has recently dropped the COVID vaccine recommendation for healthy children and pregnant women. Here's what the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation says.

title.children: What to know about vaccinating your child against COVID this winter

image.altText: A storefront that has been destroyed by fire with police inside

props.synopsis: Police say the injured men, aged 47 and 54, were working security at the store after its owners received threats.

title.children: Men guarding tobacconist seriously burned in 'targeted attack'

image.altText: The exterior of a Commonwealth Bank branchm including the brand's logos.

props.synopsis: Commonwealth Bank customers reported problems with electronic transfers from their accounts, while stock markets digest the latest US tariff developments — as it happened.

title.children: CBA customers hit by transfer glitch, ASX finishes the day higher

image.altText: A cloud of smoke rising in the background as people walk on dirt paths

props.synopsis: Sources say the agreement calls for a 60-day pause in fighting, guarantees of serious negotiations leading to a long-term truce, and assurances that Israel will not resume hostilities after the release of hostages, as it did in March.

title.children: Israel accepts US's Gaza ceasefire proposal, Hamas says it will study it

image.altText: A silver dome at Wesfarmer's Kleenheat production plant in Kwinana, near Perth.

props.synopsis: The prospect of a gas reservation scheme could be revived by Labor, with ministers signalling the sector's supply of gas to Australia is under review and noting that states with schemes already in place have been able to operate successfully.

title.children: Governments doubling down on gas as 2029 shortfall warning looms

image.altText: Chimneys from Scarborough's Pluto gas facility with flames coming from them.

props.synopsis: When the world began stepping back from hydrocarbons and petrochemicals as governments embraced zero emissions pledges, Woodside stepped forward.

title.children: Doubling down on hydrocarbons — Woodside's big gamble

image.altText: A dense crowd of people spill from a sidewalk onto a road and hold up phones

props.synopsis: "Manhattanhenge" bathed New York streets in an orange glow as fans of the phenomenon turned out in droves for a glimpse.

title.children: Crowds block New York traffic to catch glimpse of sunset phenomenon

image.altText: A woman in a striped yellow top sits with her hands clasped under her chin

props.synopsis: The court heard Racquel "Kelly" Smith, her boyfriend and a mutual friend sold the girl to a traditional healer, who was interested in her green eyes and fair complexion.

title.children: Woman who sold six-year-old daughter jailed for life in South Africa

image.altText: A persons hand paying as a cafe with a man holding an EFTPOS machine

props.synopsis: It’s common — and legal — for businesses such as cafes to charge extra on weekends for services.

title.children: Why your coffee may cost more on the weekend

image.altText: A sign with the words 'healthcare not handcuffs'

props.synopsis: A leading UK police body has advised investigators to search apps and homes if they believe a stillbirth was the result of a terminated pregnancy outside of legally permitted circumstances.

title.children: More women in the UK are being persecuted for abortion. Here's how

image.altText: Claire Jensen and her husband take a selfie in a field

props.synopsis: We spoke to four people about the different ways they handle chore splitting in their home.

title.children: How these four households split domestic chores

image.altText: A paraglider is seen in the sky inside a white cloud grimacing

props.synopsis: Peng Yujiang was testing a second-hand paragliding set-up when he was sucked into a cumulonimbus cloud, where temperatures can plummet to -40C and oxygen levels are severely low.

title.children: Paraglider 'won't fly for a while' after being sucked 8km in the air

image.altText: A man wearing a suit holds up a closed fist

props.synopsis: A United States appeals court temporarily reinstates Donald Trump's tariffs, a day after they were deemed illegal by the US Court of International Trade.

title.children: US appeals court temporarily reinstates Donald Trump's tariffs

image.altText: Man with hand raised with political advertising behind him

props.synopsis: Nepean MP Sam Groth has been asked to explain his actions by senior party figures after he used a taxpayer-funded car to travel home from the Australian Open last year.

title.children: 'Victorians deserve better': Lib MP criticises Groth over taxpayer-funded car ride

image.altText: A huge crowd of people holding a protest in a city CBD beneath a clear sky.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will cap its Emergency Services and Volunteers Fund levy at the 2024/25 rate for all primary production properties across the state for the coming financial year.

title.children: Victorian government backs down on emergency services levy for farmers

image.altText: A hi-vis yellow hard hat with Alcoa printed on the front.

props.synopsis: US aluminium giant Alcoa wants to expand mining operations in Western Australia's jarrah forests, setting the stage for a battle with environmentalists over the impact on wildlife and water quality. Here's what's at stake.

title.children: Inside Alcoa's plans to expand mining in the world's only jarrah forests

image.altText: Sean 'Diddy' Combs blows kisses to people in the audience during his sex trafficking and racketeering trial

props.synopsis: Plus the hunt is on for the next generation of Australian horror creators, and Lorde releases second single.

title.children: Diddy's ex-assistant testifies about alleged abuse, rape at hands of former boss

image.altText: Three members of the Matildas stand in arrivals at Sydney Airport, with the skipper (centre) holding a big trophy.

props.synopsis: The Matildas' 2010 Asian Cup win is the focus of a new documentary ahead of Australia hosting the event, with players hoping the film has a big impact on fans.

title.children: New Matildas doco sheds light on game-changing Asian Cup win

image.altText: Participants came from all over, some dressed in costume for the event.

props.synopsis: From a Coalition reunion to a giant wheel of cheese. This week was a big one. Test yourself on how much you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An Origin clash, a federal reunion and a cheese chase

image.altText: An ambulance helicopter lands on a rooftop helipad at night.

props.synopsis: Police have stepped up patrols after an "isolated incident" in East Gippsland that left four men in hospital with knife wounds after they were allegedly attacked by a 24-year-old woman.

title.children: Woolies worker in serious condition following alleged stabbing spree
